00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  *  @brief  Bottleneck strongly connected spanning subgraph problem 
00003  *          implemenation.
00004  *
00005  *  Implemenation of the bottleneck strongly connected spanning subgraph 
00006  *  problem (BSCSSP) that's used as a lower bound for the Bottleneck TSP
00007  *  objective value.
00008  *
00009  *  @author  John LaRusic
00010  *  @ingroup lib
00011  ****************************************************************************/
00012 #include "common.h"
00013 #include "lb.h"
00014 
00015 /****************************************************************************
00016  * Private function prototypes
00017  ****************************************************************************/
00018 /**
00019  *  @brief  Determines if the given graph is strongly connected.
00020  *  @param  problem [in] the problem instance
00021  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00022  *  @param  result [out] the result!
00023  */
00024 int
00025 strongly_connected(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int *result);
00026 
00027 /**
00028  *  @brief  Performs a recursive depth-first search to test for connectivity
00029  *  @param  problem [in] the problem instance
00030  *  @param  delta [in] delta parameter
00031  *  @param  i [in] node index to search from
00032  *  @param  transpose [in] if true, calculates costs with transposed cost
00033  *              matrix
00034  *  @param  visited [out] array that marks nodes that have been visited
00035  */
00036 void
00037 strongly_connected_dfs(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int i, 
00038                        int transpose, int *visited);
00039                        
00040 /****************************************************************************
00041  * Public function implementations
00042  ****************************************************************************/
00043 int
00044 arrow_bscssp_solve(arrow_problem *problem, arrow_problem_info *info, 
00045                    arrow_bound_result *result)
00046 {
00047     int ret;
00048     int low, high, median;
00049     int connected;
00050     double start_time, end_time;
00051     
00052     /* Start binary search */
00053     start_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00054     low = 0;
00055     high = info->cost_list_length - 1;
00056     while(low != high)
00057     {
00058         median = ((high - low) / 2) + low;
00059         
00060         /* Determine is graph is biconnected if we consider only costs less
00061          * than or equal to the median value. */
00062         ret = strongly_connected(problem, info->cost_list[median], 
00063                                  &connected);
00064         
00065         if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE)
00066         {
00067             result->obj_value = -1;
00068             return ARROW_FAILURE;
00069         }  
00070         else
00071         {
00072             if(connected == ARROW_TRUE)
00073                 high = median;
00074             else
00075                 low = median + 1;
00076         }
00077     }
00078     end_time = arrow_util_zeit();
00079     
00080     /* Return the cost we converged to as the answer */
00081     result->obj_value = info->cost_list[low];
00082     result->total_time = end_time - start_time;
00083     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00084 }
00085 
00086 int
00087 strongly_connected(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int *result)
00088 {
00089     int i;
00090     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00091     int *visited = NULL;
00092     
00093     /* Initialize arrays */
00094     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(problem->size, &visited);
00095     if(ret == ARROW_FAILURE) goto CLEANUP; 
00096     
00097     /* We start by assuming the graph is strongly connected */
00098     *result = ARROW_TRUE;
00099     
00100     /* Perform DFS from node 0 to see if we can reach every node */
00101     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00102         visited[i] = 0;
00103 
00104     strongly_connected_dfs(problem, delta, 0, ARROW_FALSE, visited);
00105     
00106     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00107     {
00108         if(!visited[i])
00109         {
00110             *result = ARROW_FALSE;
00111             goto CLEANUP;
00112         }
00113         visited[i] = 0; /* Clear values for next DFS */
00114     }
00115     
00116     /* Now perform the same search with the transposed cost matrix */
00117     strongly_connected_dfs(problem, delta, 0, ARROW_TRUE, visited);
00118     
00119     for(i = 0; i < problem->size; i++)
00120     {
00121         if(!visited[i])
00122         {
00123             *result = ARROW_FALSE;
00124             goto CLEANUP;
00125         }
00126     }
00127     
00128 CLEANUP:
00129     if(visited != NULL) free(visited);   
00130     return ret;
00131 }
00132 
00133 void
00134 strongly_connected_dfs(arrow_problem *problem, int delta, int i, 
00135                        int transpose, int *visited)
00136 {
00137     int j, cost;
00138     visited[i] = ARROW_TRUE;
00139     
00140     for(j = 0; j < problem->size; j++)
00141     {
00142         if((i != j) && (!visited[j]))
00143         {
00144             if(transpose)
00145                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, j, i);
00146             else
00147                 cost = problem->get_cost(problem, i, j);
00148             
00149             if(cost <= delta)
00150             {
00151                 strongly_connected_dfs(problem, delta, j, transpose, visited);
00152             }
00153         }
00154     }
00155 }
